Project overview  
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€  
The repository is organised as a JavaScript/TypeScript-style monorepo that contains two fully-independent applications:

1. backend/   â†’ Node + Express REST API   
2. frontend/  â†’ React SPA bootstrapped with Create-React-App

A root package.json is configured as an npm work-space so that the two sub-projects can be started, tested and linted from a single command (`npm start`, `npm test`, etc.).  Utility tooling such as Husky, ESLint, Prettier and Concurrently is installed at the root.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
BACK-END (folder backend/) â€• Stack & modules
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Language / runtime        : Node 18 (plain JS)  
Framework                 : Express 4  
Database / ODM            : MongoDB + Mongoose 7  
Auth & Security           : JSON-Web-Token, bcrypt, Helmet, express-rate-limit, express-mongo-sanitize, CORS  
Documentation             : swagger-jsdoc + swagger-ui-express  
Background jobs           : node-cron (wrapped by a custom job manager)  
Testing                   : Jest, Supertest, mongodb-memory-server  

Key folders and how they cooperate
â€¢ src/server.js â€“ single entry point.  
  - Loads .env with dotenv, connects to Mongo (`connectDB()`), registers security middleware, builds the Express app, then mounts every router module under /api/â€¦  
  - Starts an HTTP server and the background-job manager; graceful-shutdown handlers close server, jobs and DB connection.

â€¢ config/  
  - db.js â†’ responsible for making the Mongoose connection.  
  - envValidation.js & index.js â†’ read and validate environment variables and expose a central config object.  
  - swagger.js â†’ creates Swagger UI route.

â€¢ middleware/  
  - authMiddleware.js (JWT verification)  
  - roleMiddleware.js (RBAC)  
  - securityMiddleware.js (helmet, rate-limit, compression, mongo-sanitize, etc.).  `configureSecurityMiddleware` returns an array that `server.js` spreads into `app.use()`.

â€¢ models/  
  Mongoose schemas for User, Deliverer, Delivery.  Schemas add indexes, enum validation, timestamps, etc.  Example: `deliveryModel.js` defines pagination, compound indexes and validation rules.

â€¢ controllers/  
  Pure business logic.  Each exports async CRUD handlers (e.g. `createDelivery`, `getAllDeliveries`, â€¦).  Controllers import the corresponding Mongoose model and are completely decoupled from Express.

â€¢ routes/  
  Each **routes/*.js** file instantiates an Express Router and wires URL paths to controller methods plus auth / role middleware.  
  Example pipeline for a request to `/api/deliveries`:  
    Express â†’ router/deliveryRoutes.js â†’ authMiddleware â†’ controller/deliveryController.js â†’ Mongoose model â†’ MongoDB

â€¢ jobs/  
  node-cron powered tasks (data cleanup, health check, overdue delivery reminders, etc.). `jobs/index.js` exports `jobManager` with `startAllJobs` / `stopAllJobs` so that `server.js` can control them.

â€¢ data/  
  Scheduler job outputs â€“ JSON snapshots of health checks, performance metrics and processed notifications that the jobs read/write.

â€¢ _tests_ / scripts/  
  Jest unit / integration tests use an in-memory MongoDB; scripts provide seed & migration helpers.

Flow diagram (backend)  
Request â†’ Express server â†’ shared security middleware â†’ route module â†’ controller â†’ Mongoose model â†’ MongoDB â†’ controller formats response â†’ Express sends JSON.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
FRONT-END (folder frontend/) â€• Stack & modules
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Language / runtime   : React 18 (CRA) + JSX  
Routing              : react-router-dom v6  
HTTP client          : axios (wrapped in a central `HttpClient` class)  
State                : Built-in React hooks; no Redux/MobX â€“ local state & context only  
Styling / UI         : TailwindCSS 3, shadcn-ui patterns, Lucide icons  
Internationalisation : i18next + react-i18next; translation JSONs in `locales/`  
Data-viz             : chart.js + react-chartjs-2  
Forms / validation   : react-hook-form, zod  
Build / QA           : CRA scripts, ESLint, Prettier, Storybook, Jest + RTL  

Key folders and how they cooperate
â€¢ src/App.js  
  Top-level router.  Public route `/login`; everything else is wrapped in `ProtectedRoute` which checks JWT-presence.  Child routes render inside `DashboardLayout`.

â€¢ components/  
  Organised by feature: Deliveries, Deliverers, Analytics, Jobs, Settings, plus a large `UI/` design-system (accordion, dialog, data-table, charts, etc.).  Most heavy pages are lazy-loaded through `components/lazyComponents.js` for code-splitting.

â€¢ services/  
  - `http.js`â€Šâ†’ creates a singleton axios instance.  Adds the JWT to headers, global error handling, redirects to /login on 401.  
  - `api/â€¦Service.js` files wrap domain endpoints (deliveryService, authService, delivererService).  Every method calls the axios client and returns the trimmed `data` payload, keeping React code clean.

â€¢ hooks/  
  Custom hooks (`useFormAutosave`, `usePerformance`, `useTranslation`, etc.) share logic across components.

â€¢ constants/, utils/, lib/  
  Helper files (colour maps, accessibility helpers, lazy import utilities, etc.).

Flow diagram (front-end)  
Component mounts â†’ calls service method (`deliveryService.getDeliveries()`) â†’ axios sends HTTP request to Express `/api/deliveries` â†’ receives JSON â†’ component updates state â†’ UI re-renders.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
End-to-end interaction
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
1. User logs in through `/login`.  
   â€¢ Front-end posts credentials to `/api/auth/login`.  
   â€¢ Back-end `authRoutes.js` calls `userController.login`; JWT issued.  
   â€¢ Front-end stores token in localStorage; axios interceptor appends it to future headers.

2. User navigates to Deliveries page.  
   â€¢ `DeliveriesPage` mounts â†’ `deliveryService.getDeliveries()` GET /api/deliveries?page=1&limit=10  
   â€¢ Back-end `deliveryRoutes.js` routes to `deliveryController.getAllDeliveries` which queries Mongoose with pagination plugin.  
   â€¢ JSON list returned â†’ React table component displays it.

3. Background: `overdueDeliveryJob.js` runs via node-cron every X minutes, querying the same Delivery model, updating statuses, and persisting results into `data/processed_notifications/â€¦`.

4. Real-time: server has socket.io installed (dependency present, though no socket code shown in snapshot), so future live updates could be emitted to the front-end.

Below is a gap-analysis rather than an exhaustive code review. It concentrates on the kinds of issues you asked for: duplicate files / logic, naming or architectural inconsistencies, and â€œhalf-wiredâ€ technologies that have been started but not finished.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
1.   Duplicate or redundant files / logic
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Front-end  
1.1  Delivery form  
      â€¢ `src/components/DeliveryForm.js`  
      â€¢ `src/components/Deliveries/DeliveryForm.js`  
      Two totally different implementations (one small â€œMVPâ€ form, one large shadcn-UI version).  Pick one and delete/move the other â€“ otherwise imports will be ambiguous.

1.2  Language switcher  
      â€¢ `UI/language-switcher.js`  (kebab-case)  
      â€¢ `UI/LanguageSwitcher.js`   (PascalCase, imports non-existent `./dropdown-menu`)  
      These differ slightly, but only one should live in the code-base.  Decide which API you like, delete the other, and update imports.

1.3  Data-example demo  
      â€¢ `UI/DataExamples.js`  
      â€¢ `DataExamples/DataExamplesPage.js`  
      Same idea, two places.  Consolidate under a single route/component.

1.4  Naming duplicates caused by case  
      Windows is case-insensitive, but *nix CI / prod builds are not.  Example:  
        `AddressAutocomplete.js` vs import path `â€¦/ui/address-autocomplete`  
      This will break the build on Linux containers.

1.5  Misc. unused experiments  
      â€¢ `UI/rename-script.js` â€“ handy, but not used anywhere and brings `fs`, `path`, etc. into a CRA bundle if accidentally imported.  
      â€¢ `scripts/analyze-components*` â€“ fine for tooling, but ensure they are excluded from production build.

Back-end  
1.6  No obvious code duplication.  However root level has **two** Jest installations (root + backend) â€“ keep only one.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
2.   Inconsistent conventions
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
2.1  File-name casing  
      Some new UI uses kebab-case (shadcn standard: `dropdown.js`, `toast.js`, â€¦) while older pieces use PascalCase (`LanguageSwitcher.js`, `AddressAutocomplete.js`).  
      â€¢ Adopt ONE convention (e.g. kebab-case for UI primitives) and run the rename-script once.  
      â€¢ Add an ESLint rule (`@tanstack/eslint-plugin`) or Husky check to stop regressions.

2.2  Import paths  
      New code uses alias imports (`@/components/ui/button`); CRA does **not** understand that without a `jsconfig.json` or `craco`/webpack alias override.  Builds will fail outside of VS Code.  
      â€¢ Add `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` with `"baseUrl": "src", "paths": { "@/*": ["*"] }`  
      â€¢ Or switch back to relative imports.

2.3  Dependency duplication  
      Root `package.json` lists many front-end packages already listed in `frontend/package.json` (`react-scripts`, `@testing-library/*`, `react-router-dom`, â€¦).  Keep them only in the frontend workspace to avoid double installs and version drift.

2.4  Storybook vs UI primitives  
      Storybook is configured and some `*.stories.js` exist, but brand-new UI components lack stories.  Either:  
      â€¢ commit to Storybook and add stories for every shadcn component wrapper, or  
      â€¢ remove Storybook deps & scripts.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
3.   Partially implemented / placeholder tech
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
3.1  Socket.io real-time layer  
      Dependency present and `configureSocketSecurity()` exists, but:  
      â€¢ `src/server.js` never creates a Socket.io server nor emits events.  
      â€¢ Front-end has no socket client.  
      Action: either finish the feature (create real-time delivery-status channel, etc.) or drop the dependency for now.

3.2  Radix UI primitives  
      Several shadcn wrappers reference Radix sub-modules that are **not** wrapped yet (see `LanguageSwitcher.js` import `./dropdown-menu`).  Ensure every `â€¦/ui/*` barrel exports the Radix component or update imports.

3.3  Path aliases (see 2.2) â€“ declared in code, not configured in tooling.

3.4  Performance monitoring hook (`usePerformance.js`) and back-end `performanceMonitoringJob` are both implemented, but there is **no surface in the UI** that consumes the metrics JSON created by the job.  Expose them in the Analytics page or drop the job.

3.5  Background jobs dashboard  
      `JobManager` logs a â€œdashboardâ€ URL (`/api/jobs/dashboard`) but no route/controller serves that path â€“ a 404 today.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
4.   Quick consistency checklist
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
âœ“â€ƒPick a single file-naming policy; run the rename-script and update imports.  
âœ“â€ƒDelete one of each duplicated component (DeliveryForm, LanguageSwitcher, DataExamples).  
âœ“â€ƒAdd `jsconfig.json` (or webpack alias) so `@/â€¦` imports compile.  
âœ“â€ƒRemove duplicate dependencies from root or sub-packages; keep packages only where they are used.  
âœ“â€ƒEither finish or strip Socket.io, Job dashboard, Storybook, Performance analytics.  
âœ“â€ƒAdd CI lint rule for case-sensitive paths (`eslint-plugin-import/no-unresolved` with `caseSensitive` option).

Once these clean-ups are done the project will feel cohesive and â€œproduction readyâ€ instead of a mix of v1 and v2 code.

ğŸš€ Tier 2 â€“ complete half-finished features
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
2-A.  Real-time updates (Socket.io) â€“ FINISH or REMOVE  
      â€¢ Finish path:  
          â€“ Create `socket.io` server in `src/server.js` (`const io = new Server(server, configureSocketSecurity(config))`).  
          â€“ Emit `deliveryStatusChanged` events in `deliveryController.updateStatus`.  
          â€“ Add React context + hook that subscribes via `socket.io-client` to display toast/notification.  
      â€¢ Quick win: if feature is deferred, uninstall `socket.io` & delete helper code.  
      â€¢ Owner: Full-stack engineer

2-B.  Background-job dashboard endpoint  
      â€¢ Implement `GET /api/jobs/dashboard` in new `jobsController.js` returning `jobManager.getJobStatus()`.  
      â€¢ Add React â€œJobsâ€ page that hits it and shows status cards.  
      â€¢ Owner: Back-end for API, Front-end for UI

2-C.  Performance metrics surfacing  
      â€¢ Expose `/api/statistics/performance` that streams last N JSON files from `data/metrics/`.  
      â€¢ Hook Analytics page to render charts (already have chart components).  
      â€¢ Owner: Analytics engineer

2-D.  Storybook parity  
      â€¢ For **every** UI primitive in `components/UI` add a `.stories.js`.  
      â€¢ Enable a Chromatic or CI visual regression run.  
      â€¢ Owner: Design-systems / UI engineer

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
ğŸ§¹ Tier 3 â€“ polish & future-proofing
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
3-A.  Security pass  
      â€¢ Add integration test that asserts Helmet headers on a sample route.  
      â€¢ Run `npm audit fix --force` and manually vet remaining advisories.  
      â€¢ Consider adding `@fastify/rate-limit` if moving to Fastify later.

3-B.  End-to-end (E2E) tests  
      â€¢ Pick Playwright or Cypress; write happy-path: login â†’ create delivery â†’ mark as delivered.  
      â€¢ Integrate with GitHub Actions matrix (Chrome + WebKit).

3-C.  TypeScript migration plan  
      â€¢ Start with shared types in `/types/`. Migrate API models & React hooks first.  
      â€¢ Configure `tsconfig.json --noImplicitAny true`.

3-D.  Accessibility audit  
      â€¢ Run axe-ci on Storybook; fix colour contrast & aria-attributes flagged.  
      â€¢ Ensure focus-trap on dialogs, skip-link works.

3-E.  CI / CD pipeline  
      â€¢ Add GitHub Action: install, lint, test, build.  
      â€¢ Optional: push Docker images (`backend`, `frontend`) to GHCR and deploy with Docker-compose.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Sugested execution timeline
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Week 1  
  â€“ Handle Tier 0 blockers (aliases, duplicates, deps).  
  â€“ Agree & document naming convention (start 1-A).  

Week 2  
  â€“ Finish 1-A rename + ESLint rule.  
  â€“ Tackle 1-B folder moves and update imports.  
  â€“ Consolidate Jest configs (1-C).

Week 3-4  
  â€“ Implement or remove Socket.io (2-A).  
  â€“ Expose Job dashboard API + simple page (2-B).  
  â€“ Add performance endpoint & charts (2-C).  

Week 5  
  â€“ Add Storybook stories & CI visual tests (2-D).  
  â€“ Run full security / dependency scan (3-A).  

Week 6-8  
  â€“ Spin up Playwright tests, add to CI (3-B).  
  â€“ Kick-off gradual TypeScript migration (3-C).  
  â€“ Perform accessibility fixes (3-D).

Ongoing  
  â€“ Maintain CI/CD (3-E), add new tests for each new feature, enforce lint-stage & commit hooks.

Following this ordered plan will remove immediate build issues, align the code-base under one set of conventions, and then layer on the strategic enhancements that move the dashboard from â€œworking demoâ€ to â€œproduction-ready platform.â€

```diff
+           {suggestions.map((suggestion, index) => (
+             <li
+               key={index}
+               onClick={() => handleSelectSuggestion(suggestion)}
+               className={cn(
+                 'cursor-pointer px-4 py-2 text-sm hover:bg-muted',
+                 'focus:bg-muted focus:outline-none'
+               )}
+             >
+               {suggestion}
+             </li>
+           ))}
+         </ul>
+       )}
      </div>
    );
```

<no message>

---

```diff
- 
+ import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
+ import { Input } from './input';
+ import { cn } from '../../lib/utils';
+ 
+ /**
+  * AddressAutocomplete component
+  * Provides address search and autocomplete functionality
+  * 
+  * @param {Object} props - Component props
+  * @param {string} props.id - Input ID
+  * @param {string} props.value - Current value
+  * @param {Function} props.onSelect - Callback when an address is selected
+  * @param {string} props.placeholder - Input placeholder
+  * @param {boolean} props.required - Whether the field is required
+  * @param {string} props.className - Additional CSS classes
+  */
+ const AddressAutocomplete = ({
+   id,
+   value = '',
+   onSelect,
+   placeholder = 'Enter address',
+   required = false,
+   className,
+   ...props
+ }) => {
+   const [inputValue, setInputValue] = useState(value);
+   const [suggestions, setSuggestions] = useState([]);
+   const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(false);
+   const [showSuggestions, setShowSuggestions] = useState(false);
+   const suggestionRef = useRef(null);
+   
+   // Update input value when the value prop changes
+   useEffect(() => {
+     setInputValue(value);
+   }, [value]);
+   
+   // Close suggestions when clicking outside
+   useEffect(() => {
+     const handleClickOutside = (event) => {
+       if (suggestionRef.current && !suggestionRef.current.contains(event.target)) {
+         setShowSuggestions(false);
+       }
+     };
+     
+     document.addEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
+     return () => {
+       document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
+     };
+   }, []);
+   
+   // Mock API call for address suggestions
+   const fetchAddressSuggestions = async (query) => {
+     setIsLoading(true);
+     
+     try {
+       // In a real app, this would be an API call to a geocoding service
+       // For demo purposes, we'll simulate a delay and return mock data
+       await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 300));
+       
+       if (!query.trim()) {
+         setSuggestions([]);
+         return;
+       }
+       
+       // Mock suggestions based on input
+       const mockSuggestions = [
+         `${query} Street, New York, NY`,
+         `${query} Avenue, Chicago, IL`,
+         `${query} Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA`,
+         `${query} Road, Miami, FL`,
+       ];
+       
+       setSuggestions(mockSuggestions);
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error('Error fetching address suggestions:', error);
+       setSuggestions([]);
+     } finally {
+       setIsLoading(false);
+     }
+   };
+   
+   // Handle input change
+   const handleInputChange = (e) => {
+     const value = e.target.value;
+     setInputValue(value);
+     
+     // Fetch suggestions when typing
+     if (value.length > 2) {
+       fetchAddressSuggestions(value);
+       setShowSuggestions(true);
+     } else {
+       setSuggestions([]);
+       setShowSuggestions(false);
+     }
+   };
+   
+   // Handle suggestion selection
+   const handleSelectSuggestion = (suggestion) => {
+     setInputValue(suggestion);
+     setSuggestions([]);
+     setShowSuggestions(false);
+     
+     if (onSelect) {
+       onSelect(suggestion);
+     }
+   };
+   
+   return (
+     <div className="relative" ref={suggestionRef}>
+       <Input
+         id={id}
+         value={inputValue}
+         onChange={handleInputChange}
+         onFocus={() => inputValue.length > 2 && setShowSuggestions(true)}
+         placeholder={placeholder}
+         required={required}
+         className={className}
+         autoComplete="off"
+         {...props}
+       />
+       
+       {isLoading && (
+         <div className="absolute right-3 top-1/2 -translate-y-1/2">
+           <div className="h-4 w-4 animate-spin rounded-full border-2 border-primary border-t-transparent" />
+         </div>
+       )}
+       
+       {showSuggestions && suggestions.length > 0 && (
+         <ul className="absolute z-10 mt-1 max-h-60 w-full overflow-auto rounded-md bg-white py-1 shadow-lg ring-1 ring-black ring-opacity-5 focus:outline-none">
+           {suggestions.map((suggestion, index) => (
+             <li
+               key={index}
+               onClick={() => handleSelectSuggestion(suggestion)}
+               className={cn(
+                 'cursor-pointer px-4 py-2 text-sm hover:bg-muted',
+                 'focus:bg-muted focus:outline-none'
+               )}
+             >
+               {suggestion}
+             </li>
+           ))}
+         </ul>
+       )}
+     </div>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export default AddressAutocomplete; 
```

```diff
+ import React from 'react';
+ import { cn } from '../../lib/utils';
+ 
+ /**
+  * Command component for command palettes and search interfaces
+  */
+ const Command = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <div
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn(
+       'flex h-full w-full flex-col overflow-hidden rounded-md bg-popover text-popover-foreground',
+       className
+     )}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ Command.displayName = 'Command';
+ 
+ const CommandInput = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <div className="flex items-center border-b px-3">
+     <input
+       ref={ref}
+       className={cn(
+         'flex h-11 w-full rounded-md bg-transparent py-3 text-sm outline-none placeholder:text-muted-foreground disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50',
+         className
+       )}
+       {...props}
+     />
+   </div>
+ ));
+ CommandInput.displayName = 'CommandInput';
+ 
+ const CommandList = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <div
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn('max-h-[300px] overflow-y-auto overflow-x-hidden', className)}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ CommandList.displayName = 'CommandList';
+ 
+ const CommandEmpty = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <div
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn('py-6 text-center text-sm', className)}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ CommandEmpty.displayName = 'CommandEmpty';
+ 
+ const CommandGroup = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <div
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn(
+       'overflow-hidden p-1 text-foreground [&_[cmdk-group-heading]]:px-2 [&_[cmdk-group-heading]]:py-1.5 [&_[cmdk-group-heading]]:text-xs [&_[cmdk-group-heading]]:font-medium [&_[cmdk-group-heading]]:text-muted-foreground',
+       className
+     )}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ CommandGroup.displayName = 'CommandGroup';
+ 
+ const CommandItem = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <div
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn(
+       'relative flex cursor-default select-none items-center rounded-sm px-2 py-1.5 text-sm outline-none aria-selected:bg-accent aria-selected:text-accent-foreground data-[disabled]:pointer-events-none data-[disabled]:opacity-50',
+       className
+     )}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ CommandItem.displayName = 'CommandItem';
+ 
+ export {
+   Command,
+   CommandInput,
+   CommandList,
+   CommandEmpty,
+   CommandGroup,
+   CommandItem,
+ };
```

---

I've completed the implementation of "Tier 0 - blockers" from our roadmap. Here's a summary of what was fixed:

### 1. Path Alias Configuration
- Created `frontend/jsconfig.json` with proper configuration for `@/` path aliases
- Updated Storybook webpack configuration to correctly resolve path aliases

### 2. Duplicate Files and Name Collisions
- Deleted duplicate `DeliveryForm.js` from root components directory and updated imports
- Removed `LanguageSwitcher.js` (PascalCase) in favor of `language-switcher.js` (kebab-case)
- Deleted duplicate `DataExamples.js` from UI directory
- Renamed `AddressAutocomplete.js` to `address-autocomplete.js` for consistent kebab-case naming

### 3. Fixed Missing Component Files
- Created `textarea.js` component that was referenced but missing
- Created `command.js` component with all necessary exports for the command palette

### 4. Dependency Management
- Removed frontend-specific dependencies from root package.json
- Installed missing `i18next-http-backend` package
- Fixed theme CSS to avoid Tailwind directive conflicts

### 5. Import Path Fixes
- Updated all `@/` alias imports to use relative paths for better compatibility
- Fixed incorrect imports in various components

These changes resolved the critical build-breaking issues that would prevent the project from compiling successfully. The frontend should now build without path resolution errors or missing component errors.

Note: There might still be some build issues related to the Tailwind configuration that need further investigation, but we've addressed the immediate blockers identified in Tier 0 of our roadmap.

Project audit â€“ 7 July 2025  
=============================

I scanned the entire workspace (backend + frontend) looking for:  
â€¢ duplicate / redundant files or modules  
â€¢ overlapping or dead logic  
â€¢ inconsistent naming patterns  
â€¢ TODO / placeholder code or partially-implemented features

Below is what I found, grouped by category, followed by concrete next-steps.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
A.  Duplicate or Redundant FILES
--------------------------------------------------------------------
1. No remaining **exact duplicates** (same name & content) were found.  
   â€¢ Previous issues ( `DeliveryForm.js`, `LanguageSwitcher.js`, `DataExamples.js`, mis-cased `AddressAutocomplete` ) are now gone.  
2. Potential *functional* overlap:  
   â€¢ `frontend/src/components/UI/toast.js` vs `toast-context.js` â€“ both export Toast logic; ensure the low-level component isn't duplicated in the context wrapper.  
   â€¢ `frontend/src/components/UI/button.js` and `frontend/src/stories/ui/Button.stories.js` implement variants separately; verify Storybook uses the main button component and not an internal copy.  
3. Storybook *.stories.js* files sometimes embed small helper components (e.g. in `tooltip.stories.js`).  Consider keeping helpers inside `__stories__` or `stories/helpers/` to avoid future duplicates.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
B.  Redundant or Inconsistent LOGIC
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Frontend
â€¢  Several UI files repeat utility helpers (simple `cn()` wrappers, local `mergeClasses`, etc.).  Prefer re-exporting `cn` from `lib/utils.js`.
â€¢  ESLint warns about **1 258 total problems** â€“ only 3 errors, but 1 255 warnings.  Large clusters are:
  â€“ `tailwindcss/classnames-order` duplicates all over â†’ adopt `eslint --fix` + `prettier-plugin-tailwindcss` or disable if noise.  
  â€“ `tailwindcss/enforces-shorthand` â€“ lots of `h-4 w-4` vs `size-4`. Decide a convention.  
  â€“ `tailwindcss/no-custom-classname` â€“ custom classes like `modal-overlay`. Either migrate to Tailwind or whitelist.  
  â€“ `react-hooks/exhaustive-deps` & `no-unused-vars` â€“ indicates a few components with incomplete hook logic (e.g. `useDynamicImport.js`, `tooltip.js`, `UsersPage.js`).

Backend
â€¢  Controllers / routes / models look consistent.  No duplicated business logic detected.  
â€¢  Background-job registry (`src/jobs/index.js`) repeats job-name â†’ function mapping in two places (in `scheduleJob` and `runJobManually`).  Suggest exporting a single `jobsMap` to avoid drift.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
C.  Naming & Structure CONSISTENCY
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ Components are a mix of **kebab-case** (`address-autocomplete.js`, `language-switcher.js`) and **PascalCase** (`LoadingSpinner.js`, `ThemeExample.js`).  Pick one file-name convention (e.g. consistently kebab-case for files, PascalCase for component names inside).  
â€¢ Same for folders: `Deliveries/DeliveryForm.js` (Pascal) vs `UI/alert.js` (kebab).  
â€¢ Tailwind CSS class ordering and size-shorthand rules are partially observed.  Choose whether to enforce or relax those rules repo-wide.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
D.  Technologies / Features still INCOMPLETE or Marked for Future Work
--------------------------------------------------------------------
1. **Internationalisation**  
   â€¢ Hook `useTranslation.js` is ready, but many components still contain hard-coded text (detected by `i18next-scanner` logs).  Extraction outstanding.  
2. **Accessibility (a11y)**  
   â€¢ `lib/a11y.js` and `accessibility-checklist.md` exist, but most new UI components lack aria-attributes (see eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y warnings).  
3. **Analytics & Performance**  
   â€¢ `hooks/usePerformance.js` collects metrics but nothing sends them to a backend.  TODO: wire to an analytics endpoint or disable in prod.  
4. **CI / CD**  
   â€¢ No GitHub Actions or other pipeline config is committed.  Add lint-/test-/build-on-PR workflow.  
5. **Testing coverage**  
   â€¢ Backend has Jest tests; frontend has only a handful (`App.test.js`, `DeliveryForm.test.js`).  Many critical components lack tests.  
6. **Type safety**  
   â€¢ Project is pure JS.  `tsconfig` missing.  Roadmap mentions migrating to TypeScript (Tier 1) â€“ not started.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
E.  Recommended NEXT-STEPS
--------------------------------------------------------------------
1. **Lint clean-up**  
   a. Run `npm run lint:fix` frontend; manually address remaining `react-hooks` & `no-custom-classname` warnings.

```diff
    ],
    rules: {
-     // Enforce Tailwind CSS class sorting
-     'tailwindcss/classnames-order': 'warn',

-     'tailwindcss/no-custom-classname': 'warn',
```

Now let's address the remaining lint issues by creating a script to enforce consistent file naming conventions. Let's create a script that will help identify files that don't follow the kebab-case naming convention:

---

```diff
- 
+ /**
+  * Script to identify files that don't follow the kebab-case naming convention
+  * 
+  * Usage:
+  * node scripts/enforce-naming-convention.js
+  */
+ 
+ const fs = require('fs');
+ const path = require('path');
+ const chalk = require('chalk'); // You may need to install this: npm install chalk
+ 
+ // Directories to check
+ const DIRECTORIES = [
+   path.join(__dirname, '../src/components'),
+   path.join(__dirname, '../src/hooks'),
+   path.join(__dirname, '../src/lib'),
+   path.join(__dirname, '../src/utils'),
+ ];
+ 
+ // Files to ignore (keep as-is)
+ const IGNORED_FILES = [
+   'README.md',
+   'index.js',
+   '.DS_Store',
+ ];
+ 
+ // Extensions to check
+ const EXTENSIONS_TO_CHECK = ['.js', '.jsx', '.ts', '.tsx'];
+ 
+ // Regex for kebab-case
+ const KEBAB_CASE_REGEX = /^[a-z0-9]+(-[a-z0-9]+)*\.[a-z0-9]+$/;
+ 
+ // Function to check if a filename follows kebab-case
+ function isKebabCase(filename) {
+   return KEBAB_CASE_REGEX.test(filename);
+ }
+ 
+ // Function to get all files in a directory recursively
+ function getAllFiles(dir, fileList = []) {
+   const files = fs.readdirSync(dir);
+   
+   files.forEach(file => {
+     const filePath = path.join(dir, file);
+     
+     if (fs.statSync(filePath).isDirectory()) {
+       getAllFiles(filePath, fileList);
+     } else {
+       const ext = path.extname(file);
+       if (EXTENSIONS_TO_CHECK.includes(ext) && !IGNORED_FILES.includes(file)) {
+         fileList.push({
+           path: filePath,
+           name: file,
+           isKebabCase: isKebabCase(file),
+         });
+       }
+     }
+   });
+   
+   return fileList;
+ }
+ 
+ // Main function
+ function main() {
+   console.log(chalk.blue('Checking files for kebab-case naming convention...'));
+   
+   let allFiles = [];
+   let nonKebabCaseFiles = [];
+   
+   // Get all files from directories
+   DIRECTORIES.forEach(dir => {
+     if (fs.existsSync(dir)) {
+       const files = getAllFiles(dir);
+       allFiles = [...allFiles, ...files];
+       
+       const nonKebab = files.filter(file => !file.isKebabCase);
+       nonKebabCaseFiles = [...nonKebabCaseFiles, ...nonKebab];
+     } else {
+       console.log(chalk.yellow(`Directory not found: ${dir}`));
+     }
+   });
+   
+   // Print results
+   console.log(chalk.blue(`\nTotal files checked: ${allFiles.length}`));
+   
+   if (nonKebabCaseFiles.length === 0) {
+     console.log(chalk.green('\nAll files follow kebab-case naming convention!'));
+   } else {
+     console.log(chalk.red(`\n${nonKebabCaseFiles.length} files do not follow kebab-case naming convention:`));
+     
+     nonKebabCaseFiles.forEach(file => {
+       const relativePath = path.relative(process.cwd(), file.path);
+       const suggestedName = file.name.replace(/([A-Z])/g, '-$1').toLowerCase();
+       
+       console.log(chalk.yellow(`\n${relativePath}`));
+       console.log(chalk.green(`Suggested name: ${suggestedName}`));
+     });
+     
+     console.log(chalk.red('\nPlease rename these files to follow kebab-case naming convention.'));
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ main(); 
```

Let's create a rename script to help with renaming files to follow the kebab-case convention:

---

```diff
- 
+ /**
+  * Script to rename files to kebab-case
+  * 
+  * Usage:
+  * node scripts/rename-to-kebab-case.js [directory]
+  * 
+  * Example:
+  * node scripts/rename-to-kebab-case.js src/hooks
+  */
+ 
+ const fs = require('fs');
+ const path = require('path');
+ const chalk = require('chalk');
+ 
+ // Function to convert a filename to kebab-case
+ function toKebabCase(filename) {
+   const ext = path.extname(filename);
+   const name = path.basename(filename, ext);
+   
+   // Convert camelCase or PascalCase to kebab-case
+   const kebabName = name
+     .replace(/([a-z0-9])([A-Z])/g, '$1-$2')
+     .replace(/([A-Z])([A-Z][a-z])/g, '$1-$2')
+     .toLowerCase();
+   
+   return `${kebabName}${ext}`;
+ }
+ 
+ // Function to check if a filename follows kebab-case
+ function isKebabCase(filename) {
+   const ext = path.extname(filename);
+   const name = path.basename(filename, ext);
+   return /^[a-z0-9]+(-[a-z0-9]+)*$/.test(name);
+ }
+ 
+ // Function to rename files in a directory
+ function renameFilesInDirectory(directory) {
+   console.log(chalk.blue(`Scanning directory: ${directory}`));
+   
+   // Files to ignore (keep as-is)
+   const IGNORED_FILES = [
+     'README.md',
+     'index.js',
+     '.DS_Store',
+   ];
+   
+   // Extensions to check
+   const EXTENSIONS_TO_CHECK = ['.js', '.jsx', '.ts', '.tsx'];
+   
+   try {
+     const files = fs.readdirSync(directory);
+     
+     for (const file of files) {
+       const filePath = path.join(directory, file);
+       const stats = fs.statSync(filePath);
+       
+       if (stats.isDirectory()) {
+         // Recursively process subdirectories
+         renameFilesInDirectory(filePath);
+       } else {
+         const ext = path.extname(file);
+         
+         // Skip files that should be ignored or don't have the right extension
+         if (IGNORED_FILES.includes(file) || !EXTENSIONS_TO_CHECK.includes(ext)) {
+           continue;
+         }
+         
+         // Skip files that are already kebab-case
+         if (isKebabCase(file)) {
+           continue;
+         }
+         
+         const kebabCaseFilename = toKebabCase(file);
+         const newPath = path.join(directory, kebabCaseFilename);
+         
+         console.log(chalk.yellow(`Renaming: ${file} â†’ ${kebabCaseFilename}`));
+         
+         try {
+           fs.renameSync(filePath, newPath);
+           console.log(chalk.green(`  âœ“ Success`));
+         } catch (error) {
+           console.error(chalk.red(`  âœ— Error: ${error.message}`));
+         }
+       }
+     }
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Error processing directory ${directory}: ${error.message}`));
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Main function
+ function main() {
+   // Get directory from command line arguments
+   const targetDir = process.argv[2];
+   
+   if (!targetDir) {
+     console.error(chalk.red('Please provide a directory path'));
+     console.log(chalk.yellow('Usage: node rename-to-kebab-case.js [directory]'));
+     console.log(chalk.yellow('Example: node rename-to-kebab-case.js src/hooks'));
+     process.exit(1);
+   }
+   
+   const directory = path.resolve(process.cwd(), targetDir);
+   
+   if (!fs.existsSync(directory)) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Directory not found: ${directory}`));
+     process.exit(1);
+   }
+   
+   console.log(chalk.blue(`Converting filenames to kebab-case in: ${directory}`));
+   renameFilesInDirectory(directory);
+   console.log(chalk.green('Done!'));
+   console.log(chalk.yellow('Note: You may need to update imports in your code to reflect the new filenames.'));
+ }
+ 
+ main(); 
```

```diff
      "format": "prettier --write \"src/**/*.{js,jsx,json,css,md}\"",
```

---

Let's summarize what we've accomplished with the lint clean-up:

1. **ESLint Configuration Updates**:
   - Relaxed Tailwind CSS rules to minimize noise (classnames-order, no-custom-classname, enforces-shorthand)
   - Added react-hooks/exhaustive-deps rule to catch missing dependencies

2. **React Hooks Fixes**:
   - Fixed exhaustive-deps issues in `tooltip.js` by wrapping `calculatePosition` in `useCallback`
   - Fixed exhaustive-deps issues in `useDynamicImport.js` by adding missing dependencies
   - Fixed exhaustive-deps issues in `usePerformance.js` by capturing ref values properly

3. **Unused Variables Cleanup**:
   - Removed unused imports in `UsersPage.js` (Shield, Key, UserCheck, AlertTriangle, Settings)
   - Removed unused `cn` import from components that don't use it

4. **File Naming Convention Tools**:
   - Created `enforce-naming-convention.js` to identify files not following kebab-case
   - Created `rename-to-kebab-case.js` to help rename files to kebab-case
   - Added npm scripts for checking naming conventions and renaming files

These changes have significantly improved the code quality by:
1. Reducing ESLint warnings by relaxing non-critical rules
2. Fixing React hooks dependency issues that could cause bugs
3. Removing unused code to improve maintainability
4. Providing tools to enforce consistent file naming conventions

To complete the lint clean-up, you can now run:
```
npm run lint:naming
```
to identify files that don't follow kebab-case naming, and then use:
```
npm run rename:kebab src/hooks
```
to rename files in specific directories to follow the kebab-case convention.

Quick follow-up audit (after the last round of fixes)  
=====================================================

I re-scanned both code-bases and the build / lint output.  
Below is EVERYTHING that is still open, duplicated, incomplete or redundant.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
1.  File-system / naming inconsistencies
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢  42 files are still PascalCase / camelCase (see list produced by `npm run lint:naming`).  
  â€“ e.g. `src/components/Analytics/AnalyticsPage.js`, `UsersPage.js`, hooks like `useFormAutosave.js`, etc.  
â€¢  When you rename, remember to update every `import` â€“ the rename-helper script only moves files.

Action: decide whether to (a) rename all to kebab-case now or (b) relax the rule.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
2.  Duplicate or overlapping modules
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Frontend  
1.  `src/components/UI/toast.js` vs `toast-context.js`  
   â€¢ `toast.js` exports low-level Toast component + utility.  
   â€¢ `toast-context.js` re-implements its own Toast primitive and provider.  
   â€“ Suggest keeping a single source of truth (`toast.js`) and exposing context from there.

2.  Button variants appear in two places  
   â€¢ `UI/button.js` (component)  
   â€¢ Storybook stories also define custom â€œprimary/secondaryâ€ variants instead of re-using `button.js`.  
   â€“ Refactor stories to import the component and pass `variant` prop instead of duplicating class strings.

Backend  
â€¢  Job registry duplication â€“ mapping `jobName â†’ jobFunction` exists:  
  â€“ hard-coded inside `scheduleJob(...)` logic  
  â€“ duplicated in `runJobManually`.  
  â€“ Export a single `jobsMap` object from `jobs/index.js` and consume it.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
3.  Lint / build warnings that remain
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢  ESLint: only 3 errors left (all easy to fix), but ~1200 warnings are still produced if you run `npm run lint` with the strict Tailwind rules re-enabled.  
  â€“ Most are `tailwindcss/classnames-order` & `enforces-shorthand` â†’ choose: fix or keep disabled.  
â€¢  `tooltip.js` â€“ we wrapped `calculatePosition` in `useCallback`, but hook still warns that the callback depends on `position` *and* `delay` (if delay can change).  
â€¢  `usePerformance.js` â€“ Runtime works, but the hook exposes `isSupported` flag; several components import but never use it. Consider pruning unused API surface.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
4.  Incomplete features / TODO-level work
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Frontend  
â€¢  Internationalisation: majority of UI strings are still hard-coded; only the i18n plumbing exists.  
â€¢  Accessibility: many new components lack `aria-*`, tabbability, focus traps. ESLint (`jsx-a11y`) reports ~160 warnings.  
â€¢  Analytics / Performance: `usePerformance.js` collects metrics but no transport layer (e.g., POST to `/api/metrics`).  
â€¢  CI / CD: repository lacks GitHub Action or other pipeline; tests & lints only run locally.  
â€¢  Storybook â€œautodocsâ€ tags exist but the docs build is not in CI.

Backend  
â€¢  Swagger file generated, but `/src/config/swagger.js` is not referenced in `server.js` â†’ Swagger UI route never exposed.  
â€¢  Security headers middleware exists (`securityMiddleware.js`) but is not used in the Express app.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
5.  Redundant utilities
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢  Several files define tiny helpers instead of importing from `lib/utils.js` (`getInitials`, simple `truncate`, etc.).  
  â€“ Search: `function truncateText` appears twice; remove duplicates and export a single helper.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
6.  Dependency housekeeping
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢  `chalk` dev-dependency is now fixed to v4; remove the abandoned v5 lock-file entry by running `npm prune`.  
â€¢  Multiple `EBADENGINE` warnings come from packages expecting Node â‰¥ 20.  
  â€“ If you stay on Node 18 use the current versions, otherwise upgrade Node and bump packages.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
7.  Test coverage gaps
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢  Front-end: only `App`, `DeliveryForm` tests exist; none for new UI primitives.  
â€¢  Back-end: good Jest coverage for controllers, but no tests for `jobs/` or scripts.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
What to do next
--------------------------------------------------------------------
High-impact / low-effort tasks:

1. Remove duplication  
   â€“ pick **one** Toast implementation, export it, delete the other.  
   â€“ centralise `jobsMap` in backend.

2. Fast ESLint clean pass  
   â€“ run `npm run lint:fix`; manually resolve the remaining 3 errors.  
   â€“ decide rule policy (either disable the noisy Tailwind rules repo-wide or commit to fixing them).

3. Naming hygiene  
   â€“ If kebab-case is mandatory run `npm run rename:kebab src` and then `eslint --fix` to auto-update import paths.

4. Wire missing middleware  
   â€“ mount `securityMiddleware` and Swagger UI in `server.js`.

5. Add a minimal GitHub Action:  
   â€“ steps: `npm ci`, `npm run lint`, `npm test`, `npm run build` for both workspaces.

After those, the repo will be warning-free, duplicate-free and ready for bigger roadmap items (TypeScript migration, full i18n, etc.).

### Step 1: Remove duplication

```diff
- import React from 'react';
+ import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useCallback } from 'react';
  import * as ToastPrimitives from '@radix-ui/react-toast';
  import { X } from 'lucide-react';
  import { cn } from '../../lib/utils';
  
+ // Toast primitive components

```

```diff
  ));
  ToastDescription.displayName = ToastPrimitives.Description.displayName;
+ 
+ // Toast context for application-wide toast management
+ const ToastContext = createContext({
+   toast: () => {},
+   success: () => {},
+   error: () => {},
+   warning: () => {},
+   info: () => {},
+   dismiss: () => {},
+ });
+ 
+ export const useToast = () => useContext(ToastContext);
+ 
+ export const ToastContextProvider = ({ children }) => {
+   const [toasts, setToasts] = useState([]);
+ 
+   const addToast = useCallback(
+     (title, description, variant = 'default', duration = 5000) => {
+       const id = Math.random().toString(36).substring(2, 9);
+       setToasts((prev) => [...prev, { id, title, description, variant, duration }]);
+       
+       // Auto-dismiss after duration
+       setTimeout(() => {
+         setToasts((prev) => prev.filter((toast) => toast.id !== id));
+       }, duration);
+       
+       return id;
+     },
+     []
+   );
+ 
+   const dismissToast = useCallback((id) => {
+     setToasts((prev) => prev.filter((toast) => toast.id !== id));
+   }, []);
+ 
+   const toast = useCallback(
+     (title, description, duration) => addToast(title, description, 'default', duration),
+     [addToast]
+   );
+ 
+   const success = useCallback(
+     (title, description, duration) => addToast(title, description, 'success', duration),
+     [addToast]
+   );
+ 
+   const error = useCallback(
+     (title, description, duration) => addToast(title, description, 'destructive', duration),
+     [addToast]
+   );
+ 
+   const warning = useCallback(
+     (title, description, duration) => addToast(title, description, 'warning', duration),
+     [addToast]
+   );
+ 
+   const info = useCallback(
+     (title, description, duration) => addToast(title, description, 'info', duration),
+     [addToast]
+   );
+ 
+   return (
+     <ToastContext.Provider value={{ toast, success, error, warning, info, dismiss: dismissToast }}>
+       <ToastProvider>
+         {children}
+         <ToastViewport>
+           {toasts.map(({ id, title, description, variant, duration }) => (
+             <Toast key={id} variant={variant} duration={duration} onOpenChange={() => dismissToast(id)}>
+               <div className="grid gap-1">
+                 {title && <ToastTitle>{title}</ToastTitle>}
+                 {description && <ToastDescription>{description}</ToastDescription>}
+               </div>
+               <ToastClose />
+             </Toast>
+           ))}
+         </ToastViewport>
+       </ToastProvider>
+     </ToastContext.Provider>
+   );
+ };
  
  export {
```

```diff
+ #!/usr/bin/env node
+ 
  /**
-  * Script to rename files to kebab-case
+  * This script renames files to follow the kebab-case naming convention.
   * 
-  * Usage:
```

```diff
  const chalk = require('chalk');
  
- // Function to convert a filename to kebab-case
- function toKebabCase(filename) {
-   const ext = path.extname(filename);
-   const name = path.basename(filename, ext);
-   
-   // Convert camelCase or PascalCase to kebab-case
-   const kebabName = name
-     .replace(/([a-z0-9])([A-Z])/g, '$1-$2')
-     .replace(/([A-Z])([A-Z][a-z])/g, '$1-$2')
+ // Directories to exclude
+ const EXCLUDED_DIRS = [
+   'node_modules',
+   '.git',
+   'build',
+   'dist',
+   'coverage',
+ ];
+ 
+ // File extensions to check
+ const INCLUDED_EXTENSIONS = [
+   '.js',
+   '.jsx',
+   '.ts',
+   '.tsx',
+   '.css',
+   '.scss',
+ ];
+ 
+ // Files that are allowed to use PascalCase (e.g., React component files)
+ const PASCAL_CASE_EXCEPTIONS = [
+   // Add specific files that are allowed to use PascalCase here
+ ];
+ 
+ // Check if a string follows kebab-case convention
+ function isKebabCase(str) {
+   return /^[a-z0-9]+(-[a-z0-9]+)*$/.test(str);
+ }
+ 
+ // Check if a string follows PascalCase convention (for exceptions)
+ function isPascalCase(str) {
+   return /^[A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$/.test(str);
+ }
+ 
+ // Convert a string to kebab-case
+ function toKebabCase(str) {
+   return str
+     // Handle special case for uppercase acronyms (e.g., API -> api)
+     .replace(/([A-Z]+)([A-Z][a-z])/g, '$1-$2')
+     // Handle regular camelCase pattern
+     .replace(/([a-z\d])([A-Z])/g, '$1-$2')
      .toLowerCase();
-   
-   return `${kebabName}${ext}`;
- }
+ }
```

Now let's create a script to update imports in files that were renamed to kebab-case:

---

```diff
- 
+ #!/usr/bin/env node
+ 
+ /**
+  * This script updates import statements in files after renaming to kebab-case.
+  * It scans all JavaScript/TypeScript files and updates import paths.
+  * 
+  * Usage: node update-imports.js [directory]
+  * Example: node update-imports.js src
+  */
+ 
+ const fs = require('fs');
+ const path = require('path');
+ const chalk = require('chalk');
+ 
+ // Directories to exclude
+ const EXCLUDED_DIRS = [
+   'node_modules',
+   '.git',
+   'build',
+   'dist',
+   'coverage',
+ ];
+ 
+ // File extensions to process
+ const INCLUDED_EXTENSIONS = [
+   '.js',
+   '.jsx',
+   '.ts',
+   '.tsx',
+ ];
+ 
+ // Regular expression to match import statements
+ // This captures: import { X } from './path/to/File' or import X from './path/to/File'
+ const IMPORT_REGEX = /import\s+(?:{[^}]*}|\w+)\s+from\s+['"]([^'"]+)['"]/g;
+ 
+ // Convert camelCase or PascalCase to kebab-case
+ function toKebabCase(str) {
+   return str
+     .replace(/([a-z0-9])([A-Z])/g, '$1-$2')
+     .replace(/([A-Z])([A-Z][a-z])/g, '$1-$2')
+     .toLowerCase();
+ }
+ 
+ // Check if a directory should be excluded
+ function shouldExcludeDir(dirname) {
+   return EXCLUDED_DIRS.includes(path.basename(dirname));
+ }
+ 
+ // Check if a file should be processed
+ function shouldProcessFile(filename) {
+   const ext = path.extname(filename).toLowerCase();
+   return INCLUDED_EXTENSIONS.includes(ext);
+ }
+ 
+ // Convert a path to kebab-case
+ function convertPathToKebabCase(importPath) {
+   // Don't convert node_modules or absolute paths
+   if (importPath.startsWith('node_modules/') || 
+       !importPath.startsWith('.') || 
+       importPath.includes('node_modules')) {
+     return importPath;
+   }
+   
+   const parts = importPath.split('/');
+   
+   // Convert each part of the path to kebab-case if it's a file name (not a directory)
+   const convertedParts = parts.map((part, index) => {
+     // Skip empty parts, dots, or special directories
+     if (!part || part === '.' || part === '..' || part === 'node_modules') {
+       return part;
+     }
+     
+     // Check if this is the last part (file name)
+     const isLastPart = index === parts.length - 1;
+     
+     // If it's a file name without extension, convert it
+     if (isLastPart && !part.includes('.')) {
+       return toKebabCase(part);
+     }
+     
+     // If it has an extension, split by dot and convert only the filename
+     if (isLastPart && part.includes('.')) {
+       const [filename, ...extensions] = part.split('.');
+       return `${toKebabCase(filename)}.${extensions.join('.')}`;
+     }
+     
+     // For directories, we also convert to kebab-case
+     return toKebabCase(part);
+   });
+   
+   return convertedParts.join('/');
+ }
+ 
+ // Process a file to update import statements
+ function processFile(filePath) {
+   try {
+     const content = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
+     let updatedContent = content;
+     let hasChanges = false;
+     
+     // Replace import statements
+     updatedContent = content.replace(IMPORT_REGEX, (match, importPath) => {
+       const kebabCasePath = convertPathToKebabCase(importPath);
+       
+       if (importPath !== kebabCasePath) {
+         hasChanges = true;
+         return match.replace(importPath, kebabCasePath);
+       }
+       
+       return match;
+     });
+     
+     // Write changes back to file if needed
+     if (hasChanges) {
+       fs.writeFileSync(filePath, updatedContent, 'utf8');
+       console.log(chalk.green(`âœ“ Updated imports in: ${filePath}`));
+       return true;
+     }
+     
+     return false;
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Error processing file ${filePath}: ${error.message}`));
+     return false;
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Process all files in a directory recursively
+ function processDirectory(directory) {
+   let updatedFiles = 0;
+   
+   function traverse(currentPath) {
+     const files = fs.readdirSync(currentPath);
+     
+     files.forEach(file => {
+       const filePath = path.join(currentPath, file);
+       const stats = fs.statSync(filePath);
+       
+       if (stats.isDirectory()) {
+         if (!shouldExcludeDir(filePath)) {
+           updatedFiles += traverse(filePath);
+         }
+       } else if (stats.isFile() && shouldProcessFile(file)) {
+         if (processFile(filePath)) {
+           updatedFiles++;
+         }
+       }
+     });
+     
+     return updatedFiles;
+   }
+   
+   return traverse(directory);
+ }
+ 
+ // Main function
+ function main() {
+   const targetDir = process.argv[2] || '.';
+   const absolutePath = path.resolve(targetDir);
+   
+   if (!fs.existsSync(absolutePath)) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Error: Directory '${targetDir}' does not exist`));
+     process.exit(1);
+   }
+   
+   console.log(chalk.blue(`Updating import statements in: ${absolutePath}`));
+   
+   const updatedFiles = processDirectory(absolutePath);
+   
+   console.log(chalk.green(`Done! Updated imports in ${updatedFiles} files.`));
+ }
+ 
+ main(); 
```

## Summary of Changes

We've successfully implemented the three steps:

### 1. Remove duplication
- Merged toast.js and toast-context.js into a single consolidated file
- Created a centralized job registry in backend/src/jobs/index.js to avoid duplication
- Fixed duplicate export of ToastContextProvider

### 2. Fast ESLint clean pass
- Created a comprehensive .eslintrc.js configuration with relaxed Tailwind rules
- Fixed React hooks exhaustive-deps issues in:
  - use-dynamic-import.js (using functional setState)
  - use-performance.js (using a ref to avoid dependency changes)
- Removed the problematic tailwindcss/no-deprecated-classes rule

### 3. Naming hygiene
- Created scripts for enforcing kebab-case naming convention:
  - enforce-naming-convention.js to check files
  - rename-to-kebab-case.js to rename files
  - update-imports.js to update import statements
- Added npm scripts for easy execution:
  - lint:naming - Check for naming convention issues
  - rename:kebab - Rename files to kebab-case
  - update:imports - Update import statements after renaming
  - naming:fix - Run both rename and update imports scripts

These changes have significantly improved the codebase by:
1. Reducing duplication and making the code more maintainable
2. Fixing ESLint warnings and errors
3. Establishing consistent naming conventions with tools to enforce them

The codebase is now better structured and more maintainable, making it easier to implement future roadmap items.

Let's fix the display-name issue in lazy-import.js:

---

```diff
    const LazyComponent = lazy(importFn);
    
-   return (props) => (
+   // Extract component name from import function for better debugging
+   const getComponentName = () => {
+     const importPath = importFn.toString().match(/import\(['"](.+)['"]\)/);
+     if (importPath && importPath[1]) {
+       const parts = importPath[1].split('/');
+       return `Lazy(${parts[parts.length - 1]})`;
+     }
+     return 'LazyComponent';
+   };
+   
+   const LazyWithSuspense = (props) => (
      <React.Suspense fallback={fallback}>
        <LazyComponent {...props} />
      </React.Suspense>
    );
+   
+   // Set display name for better debugging
+   LazyWithSuspense.displayName = getComponentName();
+   
+   return LazyWithSuspense;
  } 
```

---

Let's create a script to fix all UI imports across the project:

---

```diff
- 
+ #!/usr/bin/env node
+ 
+ /**
+  * This script fixes UI directory imports across the project
+  * It replaces '../ui/' with '../UI/' in import statements
+  * 
+  * Usage: node fix-ui-imports.js [directory]
+  * Example: node fix-ui-imports.js src
+  */
+ 
+ const fs = require('fs');
+ const path = require('path');
+ const chalk = require('chalk');
+ 
+ // Directories to exclude
+ const EXCLUDED_DIRS = [
+   'node_modules',
+   '.git',
+   'build',
+   'dist',
+   'coverage',
+ ];
+ 
+ // File extensions to process
+ const INCLUDED_EXTENSIONS = [
+   '.js',
+   '.jsx',
+   '.ts',
+   '.tsx',
+ ];
+ 
+ // Check if a directory should be excluded
+ function shouldExcludeDir(dirname) {
+   return EXCLUDED_DIRS.includes(path.basename(dirname));
+ }
+ 
+ // Check if a file should be processed
+ function shouldProcessFile(filename) {
+   const ext = path.extname(filename).toLowerCase();
+   return INCLUDED_EXTENSIONS.includes(ext);
+ }
+ 
+ // Process a file to fix UI imports
+ function processFile(filePath) {
+   try {
+     const content = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
+     
+     // Replace '../ui/' with '../UI/' in import statements
+     const updatedContent = content.replace(/from ['"](.+)\/ui\/(.+)['"]/g, 'from \'$1/UI/$2\'');
+     
+     // Check if any changes were made
+     if (content !== updatedContent) {
+       fs.writeFileSync(filePath, updatedContent, 'utf8');
+       console.log(chalk.green(`âœ“ Fixed UI imports in: ${filePath}`));
+       return true;
+     }
+     
+     return false;
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Error processing file ${filePath}: ${error.message}`));
+     return false;
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Process all files in a directory recursively
+ function processDirectory(directory) {
+   let updatedFiles = 0;
+   
+   function traverse(currentPath) {
+     const files = fs.readdirSync(currentPath);
+     
+     files.forEach(file => {
+       const filePath = path.join(currentPath, file);
+       const stats = fs.statSync(filePath);
+       
+       if (stats.isDirectory()) {
+         if (!shouldExcludeDir(filePath)) {
+           updatedFiles += traverse(filePath);
+         }
+       } else if (stats.isFile() && shouldProcessFile(file)) {
+         if (processFile(filePath)) {
+           updatedFiles++;
+         }
+       }
+     });
+     
+     return updatedFiles;
+   }
+   
+   return traverse(directory);
+ }
+ 
+ // Main function
+ function main() {
+   const targetDir = process.argv[2] || '.';
+   const absolutePath = path.resolve(targetDir);
+   
+   if (!fs.existsSync(absolutePath)) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Error: Directory '${targetDir}' does not exist`));
+     process.exit(1);
+   }
+   
+   console.log(chalk.blue(`Fixing UI imports in: ${absolutePath}`));
+   
+   const updatedFiles = processDirectory(absolutePath);
+   
+   console.log(chalk.green(`Done! Fixed UI imports in ${updatedFiles} files.`));
+ }
+ 
+ main(); 
```

Below is a fresh â€Ÿstate-of-the-codebaseâ€ audit focused on six areas: duplication, unfinished work, inconsistencies / errors, redundant logic, missing infrastructure and general risk hot-spots.  None of the findings require immediate code changes, but they will help you decide what to tackle next.

----------------------------------------------------------------
1  Directory / file duplication
----------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ UI directory exists twice (`src/components/UI` vs `src/components/ui`).  
  â€“ Several imports still reference the lowercase path; builds fail on case-sensitive file-systems.  
  â€“ Solution: finish batch-fixing all â€œ../ui/â€¦â€ imports, then delete the lowercase folder (or vice-versa).

â€¢ `App.js` and `app.js` (both still present).  
  â€“ Keep only one; update all imports (`./app`).

â€¢ Storybook stories sometimes live beside component source and sometimes in a global `stories/` folder.  
  â€“ Pick one convention to avoid future drift.

â€¢ Toast implementation is now consolidated, but external packages (`react-toastify`) are still imported in several pages (Login, Register, etc.).  
  â€“ Migrate those to the new toast context or remove the dependency.

----------------------------------------------------------------
2  Incomplete or â€œplaceholderâ€ implementations
----------------------------------------------------------------
Frontend  
â€¢ Accessibility: many components lack keyboard handlers (`click-events-have-key-events`), `img` tags miss `alt`, and dozens of `label-has-associated-control` issues remain.  
â€¢ Internationalisation: only three pages use the i18n hook; 90 % of UI strings are still hard-coded.  
â€¢ Dark-mode / Theme switcher: UI exists but global Tailwind dark-mode class is never toggled.  
â€¢ Analytics transport: `usePerformance()` records timing but never ships the data anywhere.  
â€¢ Skeleton variants for some presets (`stats`, `chart`) are referenced but not implemented in `skeleton.js`.  

Backend  
â€¢ Security middleware (`helmet`, rate-limiter, CORS) is written but never applied in `server.js`.  
â€¢ Swagger route is defined in `config/swagger.js` but is not mounted; `/api-docs` 404s.  
â€¢ Background-job metrics are only logged to console â€“ no persistence / Prometheus exporter yet.  
â€¢ Unit-tests cover controllers but not background jobs or middleware.

Dev-ops  
â€¢ There is still no GitHub Action / pipeline; lint, test & build are manual.  
â€¢ Dockerfile is missing â€“ the README mentions containerisation as a future step.

----------------------------------------------------------------
3  Inconsistencies & errors
----------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ ESLint:  
  â€“ ~110 errors remain (mostly a11y, no-unescaped-entities, display-name).  
  â€“ ~1 300 warnings (Tailwind order, missing `propTypes`, unused vars).  
  â€“ Plugin conflicts were quieted, but rules were merely downgraded; root issues persist.

â€¢ Case sensitivity: Windows hides many problems that will break in CI / Linux (already seen with `UI` path).  

â€¢ Naming hygiene: the rename script changed files to kebab-case but some imports and `lazy()` factory strings still expect PascalCase (e.g. `Deliveries/delivery-form` vs filesystem path). Running `npm run naming:fix` followed by `npm run fix:ui-imports` caught most but not all.

â€¢ Data model drift: `priority` field exists in analytics but not in `deliveryModel.js`; API returns `priorityStats` anyway (mock data only).  

----------------------------------------------------------------
4  Redundant or unused logic
----------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ `tailwind-merge` util duplicated: exists in `lib/utils.js` and in `utils/lazy-import.js`.  
â€¢ Multiple date helpers (`date-fns` + custom `lib/utils.date` functions).  
â€¢ Performance hooks wrap native `performance` API, but many components do manual `console.time` as well â€“ consolidate.  
â€¢ Job-registry constants list job names; the same names are hard-coded again in tests (`_tests_/backgroundJobs.test.js`).  

----------------------------------------------------------------
5  Yet-to-be-implemented technologies (road-map items)
----------------------------------------------------------------
âœ“ Internationalisation coverage (strings extraction + scanner)  
âœ“ Full WCAG-AA accessibility pass  
âœ“ Observability / log aggregation (winston + cloud sink)  
âœ“ CD pipeline & Docker / Helm charts  
âœ“ AuthZ fine-grained roles (middleware placeholder exists)  
âœ“ Optimistic UI with SWR / React Query (mentioned in README but unused)  

----------------------------------------------------------------
6  Quick-win cleanup queue
----------------------------------------------------------------
1. Finish UI-path case-fix (`node scripts/fix-ui-imports.js src` until zero replacements).  
2. Delete lowercase `ui` folder, duplicate `App.js`, any renamed PascalCase files.  
3. Remove remaining `react-toastify` usage; use new toast context.  
4. Run `npm run lint:fix`; address remaining **errors** (can leave warnings for later).  
5. Mount security & swagger middleware in `server.js`; add route tests.  
6. Create a simple GitHub Action: `lint â†’ unit tests â†’ build`.  
7. Add missing `alt`, `label`, keyboard handlers to pass a11y lint.  
8. Convert hard-coded strings in high-traffic pages to `t('â€¦')`.  
9. Decide on data-export target for performance metrics, wire `usePerformance()`.

Completing the above will take the project from â€œruns locally with suppressionsâ€ to â€œCI green, production-ready baselineâ€, after which bigger features (real-time dashboards, SWR, micro-frontends) can land safely.

---

I see the issue now. We have both a lowercase "ui" directory and an uppercase "UI" directory with the same files. This is causing case sensitivity issues. Let's modify the fix-ui-imports.js script to also handle the duplicate directory issue:

---

```diff
   * This script fixes UI directory imports across the project
   * It replaces '../ui/' with '../UI/' in import statements
+  * And removes the duplicate lowercase 'ui' directory
   * 
   * Usage: node fix-ui-imports.js [directory]
```

```diff
  const path = require('path');
  const chalk = require('chalk');
+ const { execSync } = require('child_process');
  
  // Directories to exclude
```

```diff
    return traverse(directory);
  }
+ 
+ // Remove the lowercase ui directory if it exists and UI directory also exists
+ function removeLowercaseUiDirectory(baseDir) {
+   try {
+     const componentsDir = path.join(baseDir, 'components');
+     
+     if (!fs.existsSync(componentsDir)) {
+       console.log(chalk.yellow(`Components directory not found at ${componentsDir}`));
+       return false;
+     }
+     
+     const uiDirLower = path.join(componentsDir, 'ui');
+     const uiDirUpper = path.join(componentsDir, 'UI');
+     
+     if (fs.existsSync(uiDirLower) && fs.existsSync(uiDirUpper)) {
+       console.log(chalk.blue(`Found both lowercase 'ui' and uppercase 'UI' directories.`));
+       
+       // On Windows, we need to be careful with case-insensitive file systems
+       // First, make sure all files from lowercase ui are in uppercase UI
+       const uiFiles = fs.readdirSync(uiDirLower);
+       
+       uiFiles.forEach(file => {
+         const sourcePath = path.join(uiDirLower, file);
+         const targetPath = path.join(uiDirUpper, file);
+         
+         if (fs.statSync(sourcePath).isDirectory()) {
+           if (!fs.existsSync(targetPath)) {
+             // Copy directory recursively
+             fs.mkdirSync(targetPath, { recursive: true });
+             const nestedFiles = fs.readdirSync(sourcePath);
+             nestedFiles.forEach(nestedFile => {
+               const nestedSourcePath = path.join(sourcePath, nestedFile);
+               const nestedTargetPath = path.join(targetPath, nestedFile);
+               fs.copyFileSync(nestedSourcePath, nestedTargetPath);
+             });
+           }
+         } else if (!fs.existsSync(targetPath)) {
+           // Copy file
+           fs.copyFileSync(sourcePath, targetPath);
+         }
+       });
+       
+       // Use a platform-specific command to remove the directory
+       // This helps avoid case sensitivity issues on Windows
+       try {
+         if (process.platform === 'win32') {
+           execSync(`rmdir /s /q "${uiDirLower}"`, { stdio: 'ignore' });
+         } else {
+           execSync(`rm -rf "${uiDirLower}"`, { stdio: 'ignore' });
+         }
+         console.log(chalk.green(`âœ“ Removed duplicate lowercase 'ui' directory`));
+         return true;
+       } catch (error) {
+         console.error(chalk.red(`Error removing lowercase 'ui' directory: ${error.message}`));
+         return false;
+       }
+     }
+     
+     return false;
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(chalk.red(`Error handling directories: ${error.message}`));
+     return false;
+   }
+ }
  
  // Main function
```

```diff
    
    const updatedFiles = processDirectory(absolutePath);
+   const removedDir = removeLowercaseUiDirectory(absolutePath);
    
    console.log(chalk.green(`Done! Fixed UI imports in ${updatedFiles} files.`));
+   if (removedDir) {
+     console.log(chalk.green(`Successfully removed duplicate lowercase 'ui' directory.`));
+   }
  }
  
```

Now let's create the missing UI component files. First, let's create the a11y-announcer.js file:

---

```diff
- 
+ import React, { createContext, useContext, useState } from 'react';
+ 
+ // Create a context for the announcements
+ const AnnouncerContext = createContext();
+ 
+ /**
+  * Provides an accessibility announcer context for screen readers
+  */
+ export function AccessibilityAnnouncerProvider({ children }) {
+   const [announcements, setAnnouncements] = useState({
+     polite: '',
+     assertive: '',
+   });
+ 
+   // Function to announce messages to screen readers
+   const announce = (message, politeness = 'polite') => {
+     if (politeness !== 'polite' && politeness !== 'assertive') {
+       console.warn('Politeness must be either "polite" or "assertive"');
+       politeness = 'polite';
+     }
+ 
+     setAnnouncements(prev => ({
+       ...prev,
+       [politeness]: message,
+     }));
+ 
+     // Clear the announcement after it's been read
+     setTimeout(() => {
+       setAnnouncements(prev => ({
+         ...prev,
+         [politeness]: '',
+       }));
+     }, 3000);
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <AnnouncerContext.Provider value={{ announcements, announce }}>
+       {children}
+       <AccessibilityAnnouncer announcements={announcements} />
+     </AnnouncerContext.Provider>
+   );
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Hook to use the announcer
+  */
+ export function useAnnouncer() {
+   const context = useContext(AnnouncerContext);
+   if (!context) {
+     throw new Error('useAnnouncer must be used within an AccessibilityAnnouncerProvider');
+   }
+   return context.announce;
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * The actual announcer component that renders visually hidden elements for screen readers
+  */
+ function AccessibilityAnnouncer({ announcements }) {
+   return (
+     <div aria-live="polite" aria-atomic="true" className="sr-only">
+       {announcements.polite}
+     </div>
+   );
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Component to announce content to screen readers
+  */
+ export function Announce({ message, politeness = 'polite', children }) {
+   const announce = useAnnouncer();
+   
+   React.useEffect(() => {
+     if (message) {
+       announce(message, politeness);
+     }
+   }, [message, politeness, announce]);
+   
+   return <>{children}</>;
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Main component that can be imported and used in the app
+  */
+ export function AccessibilityAnnouncer({ title }) {
+   return (
+     <AccessibilityAnnouncerProvider>
+       {title && <h2 className="sr-only">{title}</h2>}
+     </AccessibilityAnnouncerProvider>
+   );
+ } 
```

```diff
+ import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useCallback } from 'react';
+ 
+ // Create context for toast notifications
+ const ToastContext = createContext();
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast primitive component
+  */
+ export const Toast = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => {
+   return (
+     <div
+       ref={ref}
+       role="status"
+       aria-live="polite"
+       className={`bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-md shadow-lg p-4 ${className || ''}`}
+       {...props}
+     />
+   );
+ });
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast with variants (success, error, warning, info)
+  */
+ export const ToastWithVariant = React.forwardRef(({ className, variant, ...props }, ref) => {
+   const variantClasses = {
+     default: 'border-gray-200 dark:border-gray-700',
+     success: 'border-green-500 bg-green-50 dark:bg-green-900/20',
+     error: 'border-red-500 bg-red-50 dark:bg-red-900/20',
+     warning: 'border-yellow-500 bg-yellow-50 dark:bg-yellow-900/20',
+     info: 'border-blue-500 bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-900/20',
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <Toast
+       ref={ref}
+       className={`border-l-4 ${variantClasses[variant || 'default']} ${className || ''}`}
+       {...props}
+     />
+   );
+ });
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast title component
+  */
+ export const ToastTitle = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => {
+   return (
+     <div
+       ref={ref}
+       className={`font-medium text-sm text-gray-900 dark:text-gray-100 ${className || ''}`}
+       {...props}
+     />
+   );
+ });
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast description component
+  */
+ export const ToastDescription = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => {
+   return (
+     <div
+       ref={ref}
+       className={`text-sm text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400 mt-1 ${className || ''}`}
+       {...props}
+     />
+   );
+ });
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast action component
+  */
+ export const ToastAction = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => {
+   return (
+     <button
+       ref={ref}
+       className={`inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-md text-sm font-medium transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:opacity-50 disabled:pointer-events-none ring-offset-white dark:ring-offset-gray-950 bg-gray-100 hover:bg-gray-200 dark:bg-gray-800 dark:hover:bg-gray-700 h-8 px-3 py-2 mt-2 ${className || ''}`}
+       {...props}
+     />
+   );
+ });
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast close button component
+  */
+ export const ToastClose = React.forwardRef(({ className, ...props }, ref) => {
+   return (
+     <button
+       ref={ref}
+       className={`absolute top-2 right-2 rounded-md p-1 text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400 hover:text-gray-900 dark:hover:text-gray-50 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-offset-2 ${className || ''}`}
+       {...props}
+     >
+       <span className="sr-only">Close</span>
+       <svg width="15" height="15" viewBox="0 0 15 15" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
+         <path
+           d="M11.7816 4.03157C12.0062 3.80702 12.0062 3.44295 11.7816 3.2184C11.5571 2.99385 11.193 2.99385 10.9685 3.2184L7.50005 6.68682L4.03164 3.2184C3.80708 2.99385 3.44301 2.99385 3.21846 3.2184C2.99391 3.44295 2.99391 3.80702 3.21846 4.03157L6.68688 7.49999L3.21846 10.9684C2.99391 11.193 2.99391 11.557 3.21846 11.7816C3.44301 12.0061 3.80708 12.0061 4.03164 11.7816L7.50005 8.31316L10.9685 11.7816C11.193 12.0061 11.5571 12.0061 11.7816 11.7816C12.0062 11.557 12.0062 11.193 11.7816 10.9684L8.31322 7.49999L11.7816 4.03157Z"
+           fill="currentColor"
+         />
+       </svg>
+     </button>
+   );
+ });
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toast provider component
+  */
+ export const ToastContextProvider = ({ children }) => {
+   const [toasts, setToasts] = useState([]);
+ 
+   const addToast = useCallback((toast) => {
+     const id = Math.random().toString(36).substring(2, 9);
+     setToasts((prevToasts) => [...prevToasts, { ...toast, id }]);
+ 
+     // Auto dismiss toast after duration
+     if (toast.duration !== Infinity) {
+       setTimeout(() => {
+         removeToast(id);
+       }, toast.duration || 5000);
+     }
+ 
+     return id;
+   }, []);
+ 
+   const removeToast = useCallback((id) => {
+     setToasts((prevToasts) => prevToasts.filter((toast) => toast.id !== id));
+   }, []);
+ 
+   const value = {
+     toasts,
+     addToast,
+     removeToast,
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <ToastContext.Provider value={value}>
+       {children}
+       <div className="fixed bottom-0 right-0 z-50 p-4 flex flex-col gap-2 max-h-screen overflow-hidden">
+         {toasts.map((toast) => (
+           <ToastWithVariant key={toast.id} variant={toast.variant}>
+             {toast.title && <ToastTitle>{toast.title}</ToastTitle>}
+             {toast.description && <ToastDescription>{toast.description}</ToastDescription>}
+             {toast.action && <ToastAction onClick={toast.action.onClick}>{toast.action.label}</ToastAction>}
+             <ToastClose onClick={() => removeToast(toast.id)} />
+           </ToastWithVariant>
+         ))}
+       </div>
+     </ToastContext.Provider>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ /**
+  * Hook to use toast
+  */
+ export const useToast = () => {
+   const context = useContext(ToastContext);
+   if (!context) {
+     throw new Error('useToast must be used within a ToastContextProvider');
+   }
+   return context;
+ }; 
```
